channel.title: Repositories on Mule AI
channel.description: Recent content in Repositories on Mule AI

item.title: Adding a Repository
item.description:
Adding a repository is the action that allows mule to monitor issues and create new pull requests.

Remote Repository link

Currently a repository must exist on GitHub in order for it to be selected as a remote repository.

notifications
In future releases you will be able to create a new repository from mule or work on a local only repository.

Base Path link

The Base Path is the location where you with to locally clone the repository. When the repository is cloned, the owner and the repository name will be appended to the base path.

item.title: Interacting With a Repository
item.description:
Once you’ve added a repository to Mule, you can interact with it in several ways. This page explains how to work with repositories, manage issues, and collaborate with AI agents.

Repository Dashboard link

After adding a repository, it will appear in the dashboard with the following information:

  • Repository Name: The name of the repository
  • Provider: GitHub or Local
  • Status: Current sync status
  • Last Sync: When the repository was last synchronized
  • Actions: Buttons to interact with the repository

Synchronizing a Repository link

Mule will automatically synchronize repositories according to the schedule you specified when adding them. However, you can manually trigger a sync at any time:
